reviews.title: Security problems may arise.
reviews.text:
I have one savings product with them. Registration was a bit of a mare as I used an email I don't like to use for finance. Getting it changed was not easy but the IT guy who dealt was outstandingly competent so full stars to him.

The website is designed to mask the fact they have quite a lot of products. Only after visiting it on a laptop did I realise the block images were sub menus. Login is not the quickest with the most clunky software of any fintech I've seen.

No idea why SALESFORCE (their software provider) are so successful as, if that is classed as good fintech in the US then heaven knows what bad stuff is like. I particularly do not like the lack of login security. You either have to receive a text, which is not secure & takes far too long to arrive (5+ minutes), or their Salesforce authenticator which doesn't employ biometrics!! Really poor show for security. 

Product maturity was not smooth but I'll say again that the staff that helped were extremely good and knowledgeable. Software menus are not clear with withdraw the option you'd expect to pick but that led to a request system that did not work as no one phoned back. I should have picked view account & then close account sub menu. Still the money didn't arrive though and had to phone to get it to clear.

I think the staff are just overwhelmed with clunky poor software & maybe also management processes that do not have the best in mind for their customers.

reviews.title: Tech shortcomings undermine some good products
reviews.text: I tried to open a savings account but was unable to submit phots of ID documents through their Onfido identity check process. It didn't accept the images that I was trying to submit via my smartphone and I got into an endless loop of a failure message followed by TRY AGAIN. I was stuck with an online account that I was unable to activate. I can't say much about their account management service. But I can say that I raised the Onfido issue with customer services and their online response was to put a note in my account stating that I had not submitted the relevant documents and they were still waiting for them. This building society needs to fix its technological failures before I will try any harder, I'd rather go elsewhere. I regret providing the personal information that they asked for, I don't feel that I can trust them to delete it.

reviews.title: The Regressive Building Society
reviews.text:

Most building societies and banks - I would say over 90%- make electronic checks to confirm a depositor's identity, but Progressive seem to insist on certified copies of  utility statements.  Very customer unfriendly.
I notice that they don't answer criticisms on this website - that's very indicative  of their attitude. The CEO of Progressive should be ashamed

reviews.title: Failed Online Registration, no callback, guidance misinformation
reviews.text:
For a computer Online Registration after verifying my details (SMS code also involved), uploading my photo ID and taking the 'Selfie' (mobile phone again) the process stalled - a never-ending 'Processing' caption.

I phoned and spoke to Marie 12 Aug, their help team was unable to take my call (with hindsgight, no surprise there) - no arranged callback since (today 19 Aug).

Alarm bells should have rang for me when reading the convoluted registration process, which is reflected with other recent reviews...

Also their guidance not stating that the Selfie MUST be done using their mobile phone process.

Progressive, did you know that Selfies can also (for example) be taken on devices called 'cameras' ? !!!

I doubt I will ever get the arranged callback.

The only reason I now care about this shambles is that Progressive seemingly have all my personal details, my Photo ID and a photo of me.

I wish that I had never allowed myself to get anywhere near this Amateurish, Apathetic and Awful organisation.

The saving-grace is that they have none of my money.....

Just tried to login to the new "digital" Progressive only to find I can't! 

I do have an account but now you need SalesForce authenticator to login.

However, there is nothing from Progressive to allow a link to be added to SalesForce authenticator - so you can't login because SalesForce authenticator has to authentic you but it can't authenticate you because it is not linked to Progressive and the loop continues!

There is a "choose an alternative verification method" option but it loops straight back to SalesForce authenticator and so the farce continues.

I have seen some rubbish IT systems in my time but this one takes the crown. There must have been NO testing by the developer. Utterly incompetent! 

In short, if The Progressive wants to use Salesforce Authenticator then how about providing the QR code to allow a Progressive account in the authenticator?

If The Progressive is going to offer an option to use an alternative authentication method, how about actually providing one?
 
Completely below standards and a pathetic attempt of a digital presence!
